Name: Agatha de Mello
Description:
Agatha was shot. She died on the way to hospital.

> With sadness, we announced the passing of AGHATA DE MELLO, a victim of transphobia who was shot to death last night in Indianópolis, in the south zone of Sao Paulo. Aghata could not resist her injuries and arrived at the hospital lifeless.
> 
> Our condolences to family and friends.

Name: Betty Skinner
Description:
Betty was found dead in her apartment by a home-health aide. She had been beaten around the head.

> CLEVELAND, Ohio -- Police are investigating a suspected homicide after a 52-year-old disabled Cleveland woman was found dead in a senior apartment complex Thursday morning.
>
>A home health care worker found Betty Skinner dead in her bed at Deaconess Krafft Center in Old Brooklyn Thursday morning, with what appeared to be blunt force trauma to the head, according to police.
>
> Skinner was physically disabled and required assisted living, including regular visits from a home health care worker, police said. The worker had left Skinner's home about 10 p.m. Wednesday, before returning and finding Skinner with "severe head injuries" the next the morning.
>
> Skinner, a longtime resident of Deaconess-Krafft, legally changed her name from [deadname] in Cuyahoga County Probate Court in 2002, records indicate.
>
> The apartment's administrators released a statement Thursday saying they are cooperating with police in the investigation "but cannot offer any details."
>
>Skinner's fellow residents in the complex, who asked not to be identified, described her as friendly, nice and outgoing, despite a severe speech impediment.
>
> "I don't think anyone in this building would have done that," one man said.

TvT project: Cleveland.com 07.12.2013

https://www.lgbtqnation.com/2013/12/advocacy-group-says-deaths-of-two-ohio-transgender-women-were-hate-crimes/

Name: Brittany Stergis
Description:
Brittany was found dead inside her car, which was parked at a Cleveland public housing facility. She had been shot in the head.

In October 2014 Delshawn Carroll, 20, pleaded guilty to her murder and was sentenced to 18 years to life in prison.

> While the motive for the shooting remains unclear, prosecutors said Carroll and Stergis had a past together.
>
> At first, Carroll denied being with Stergis the night of her death. But investigators found evidence that placed Carroll inside Stergis' car, prosecutors said.
>
> Cleveland police homicide detectives pulled touch DNA that matched Carroll's from Stergis' car door handle and a cigar wrapper found inside her car. Cellphone records showed Carroll called Stergis earlier that night, and his phone pinged from a nearby tower.
>
> Ballistics testing revealed that shell casings found inside Stergis' car matched a 9 mm Smith & Wesson handgun owned by one of Carroll's family members, prosecutors said.

TvT project: Cleveland.com 07.12.2013

Name: Alondra Hidalgo Cardenas
TDoR list ref: tgeu/22-Dec-2013/Alondra Hidalgo Cardenas & tgeu/5-Jan-2014/Alondra (Freddy Ali) Hildago Cardenas
Description:
Alondra's decomposing body was found in undergrowth behind a shopping centre on Thursday 26th December.

> Maracaibo - The [trans woman] found at Kilometer 4, behind the Los Churupos shopping center on December 26, was identified by her relatives as [deadname] Hidalgo Cárdenas (21), alias "Alondra".
>
> The body remained in the University of Zulia morgue for 10 days, until last Friday when relatives came to identify her. They said that "Alondra", as they called her, began to live her life as a [trans woman] at the age of 17. When she manifested [her identity], she began to dress as a woman and live a life independent of her family.
>
> "Alondra" lived in the Pradera Alta neighborhood, behind La Chamarreta, Francisco Eugenio Bustamante parish, and [did sex work] on Circunvalación No. 2. Sometimes she stopped to work on the road to Perijá, near the El Bonchón liquor store, according to reports.
>
> Hidalgo's lifeless body was face down and in an advanced state of decomposition when it was found at 6:00 on the morning of December 26 in a hilly area. The last time [she] was seen alive was on Saturday, December 21. "She worked in the prostitute's crashed car, but she always got into a fight with the clients because she kept stealing from them," said a woman who did not want to identify herself on the day of the incident.

TvT project: Diario La Verdad 05.01.2014 & informeraxen.es 30.01.2014

https://www.quepasa.com.ve/sucesos/identifican-a-travesti-hallado-muerto-en-el-km-4/
Tweet:
The decomposing body of Alondra Hidalgo Cardenas was found in Maracaibo, Zulia (Venezuela) on 26 Dec 2013.

She was 21. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR
